titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the Photographs of Virginia Churches, Courthouses, Homes, and Buildings, 1959-1969
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
The Special Collections Department 11494
titlepage.publisher: Special Collections Department, University of Virginia Library

defitem.label: Funding:
defitem.item: Web version of the finding aid funded in part by a grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.unittitle:
Photographs of Virginia Churches, Courthouses, Homes, and Buildings,
1959-1969
did.physdesc: The collection consists of seven photograph albums.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
See the
University of Virginia Library’s use policy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Photographs of Virginia Churches, Courthouses, Homes, and Buildings, 1959-1969, Accession # 11494, Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These albums were purchased by the University of Virginia Library from Jerry N. Showalter, Ivy, Virginia, on April 14, 1999.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of seven photograph albums, ca. 1959-1969, containing black and white snapshots of county courthouses (3 volumes), historic homes, inns and other landmarks (3 volumes) and churches (1 volume) all in Virginia, unless otherwise noted. Each photograph is labeled by place and date of building, if known. Several have additional annotations. The only identified people are Dr. Chester Bradley and Mrs. Stewart posing in front of the Ft. Monroe Casemate Museum. Three earlier photographs of the Fountain Hotel, Rustburg, Va., are included.
